intro: Salsola moorcroftiana, commonly known as Russian thorn or stonecress, is a flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as deserts and rocky slopes. The plant has succulent, spiny stems and small, fleshy leaves that help it retain water in harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually greenish-white and clustered in dense inflorescences. Salsola moorcroftiana is well adapted to extreme temperatures and low precipitation, making it a hardy species in its native range.
